forumNotes.author: hodgestructure
forumNotes.content:
I bought kingston datatraveler 150 , 64GB usb stick.  
I want to partition it (4 partitions).  
On XPï¼Œit can see the first partitions.  
I have found two ways to make multiple partitions on usb sticks. But one of them works only for those computers on which a specific driver is installed. The other way use some usb modification tool, but I can't find such tool for   
kingston datatraveler 150 .   

Is there any way to do this on my usb stick.  
Here is my usb information.  

USB Mass Storage Device(Kingston DataTraveler 150 USB Device)  
VID = 0951 PID = 1621  
0018F30C08395B9708140030  
PMAP  
phison  
PS2231\~PS2232  
Kingston  
DataTraveler 150  

I know this is not a question of usb booting.  
If you know anyforum to discuss this issue, please tell me.  
thanks.

forumNotes.author: joakim
forumNotes.content:
Did you try the Hitachi micro filter driver?  

It works for me on usb sticks from 1Gb to 16Gb on xp/vista/2008.  

Joakim

forumNotes.author: was_jaclaz
forumNotes.content:
> Did you try the Hitachi micro filter driver? > But one of them works only for those computers on which a specific driver is installed. ![:frusty:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/frusty.gif) > The other way use some usb modification tool, but I can't find such tool for > kingston datatraveler 150 . > > Is there any way to do this on my usb stick. > Here is my usb information. > > USB Mass Storage Device(Kingston DataTraveler 150 USB Device) > VID = 0951 PID = 1621 > 0018F30C08395B9708140030 > PMAP > phison > PS2231\~PS2232 > Kingston > DataTraveler 150 Flipping the "removable bit": [http://www.911cd.net...o...=22874\&st=8](http://www.911cd.net/forums//index.php?showtopic=22874&st=8 "External link") [http://flashboot.ru/...\&...rd=1\&pord=0](http://flashboot.ru/index.php?name=iflash&vord=1&pord=0 "External link") > Kingston DataTraveler 150 64 Gb VID_0951 PID_1621 -- -- Phison_UP10-UP14_1.08, CheckUDisk [http://flashboot.ru/....php?name=Files](http://flashboot.ru/index.php?name=Files "External link") [http://flashboot.ru/...les\&op=cat\&id=6](http://flashboot.ru/index.php?name=Files&op=cat&id=6 "External link")
Your mileage ***may*** vary. :wink: ![:unsure:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/unsure.png) jaclaz

forumNotes.author: hodgestructure
forumNotes.content:
Thank you very much, jaclaz.  
I have download Phison_UP10-UP14_1.08 and look a bit at the tutorial. But I don't understand one thing. When I open   

MP2232_F1_B4_V108_0A.exe  
MP2232_F2_V108_0A.exe  
ParamEdt-F1-v2.1.0.3.exe  
ParamEdt-F2-v2.1.0.3.exe  

They didn't list my kingston usb stick. In fact , they didn't list any of my usb stick or usb device. It seems that they are different from those tools I have seen before. Do you know anything about this?

forumNotes.author: was_jaclaz
forumNotes.content:
Remember that this is ***tricky*** business, be very careful in what you do, and in case anything goes wrong, you should ALWAYS say:  
> the ***devil*** made me do it
NEVER, and I mean ***NEVER*** say:  
> **jaclaz** told me to do it

:wink:  

It is possible that kingston changes the "standard" VID/PID from Phison and that the utility ONLY recognizes the original Phison ones, at least this is what happens with other chip manufacturers/OEM's.  

The procedure, I'll re-iterate, VERY RISKY, is then to change the VID/PID to the "right" one the utility recognizes, flip the bit, than restore the OEM one.  

Check this:  
[http://www.boot-land...?showtopic=1659](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/index.php?showtopic=1659 "External link")  

it may help (or completely fail to).  

General advice:  
Check also the other Mass Production Tools from Phison, read "between the lines" of the guides/docs, make sure that you installed (if any) the dedicated driver properly, disconnect ANY, and I mean ***ANY*** other USB device, use a "clean" system, possibly XP and NOT Vista, to avoid possible conflicts.  

![:frusty:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/frusty.gif)  

jaclaz
